chinese: 澤滅木，大過；君子以獨立不懼，遯世无悶。
english: (The trigram representing) trees hidden beneath that for the waters of a marsh forms Da Guo. The superior man, in accordance with this, stands up alone and has no fear, and keeps retired from the world without regret.
'He places mats of the white m?o grass under things set on the ground:' - he feels his weakness and his being in the lowest place, (and uses extraordinary care).
'An old husband and a young wife:' - such association is extraordinary.

chinese: 棟橈之凶，不可以有輔也。
english: 'The evil connected with the beam that is weak' arises from this, that no help can be given (to the condition thus represented).
'The good fortune connected with the beam curving upwards' arises from this, that it does not bend towards what is below.

chinese: 枯楊生華，何可久也。老婦士夫，亦可醜也。
english: 'A decayed willow produces flowers:' - but how can this secure its long continuance? 'An old wife and a young husband:' - this also is a thing to be ashamed of.
'Evil follows wading with (extraordinary) boldness (through the stream):' - but (the act) affords no ground for blame.
